byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and MARI-LEENA KUOSA

abstract: Trial of Helsinki's onetime head antidrug police officer Jari Aarnio on charges of smuggling narcotics has shaken Finland's citizenry and tested their steadfast confidence in law institutions; Aarnio, who was arrested in 2013, reportedly used expertise gained in his position as high-ranking officer to establish his own drug empire.
lead_paragraph: The case of the head of Helsinki’s police antidrug squad accused of running his own drug cartel has shocked a nation that prides itself on its moral uprightness.

headline.main: Finland Unnerved by Trial of Police Detective on Drug Charges
headline.print_headline: Finland Is Unnerved by Trial of Detective on Charges of Running a Drug Cartel

snippet: The case of the head of Helsinki’s police antidrug squad accused of running his own drug cartel has shocked a nation that prides itself on its moral uprightness.
